title: The mysterious science of pain - Joshua W. Pate

multiple-choice.question: What was the surprising discovery made by doctors when they removed a 29-year-old builder's boot after he accidentally jumped onto a 15-centimeter nail?

options.label: A
options.text: The nail had pierced through his foot and caused severe damage.

options.label: B
options.text: The nail had never touched his foot at all.

options.label: C
options.text: The nail had caused a minor injury, but the pain was severe.

options.label: D
options.text: The nail had broken off inside his foot and required surgery.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the difference between pain and nociception?

options.label: A
options.text: Pain is a direct response to damage, while nociception is a biological process that detects threats.

options.label: B
options.text: Pain is a biological process, while nociception is a direct response to damage.

options.label: C
options.text: Pain is a protective response, while nociception is a threat detection mechanism.

options.label: D
options.text: Pain and nociception are the same thing.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for pain that lasts more than 3 months?
According to the transcript, what is one of the factors that can influence the experience of pain?
In one study, what did children who reported believing they had no control over pain experience compared to those who believed they had some control?

options.label: B
options.text: They experienced the same amount of pain

options.label: D
options.text: They experienced no pain at all

multiple-choice.question: What feature of the environment was shown to affect perception of pain in one experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: The color of the light shown to the volunteers

options.label: B
options.text: The temperature of the rod placed on the back of their hand

options.label: D
options.text: The presence of a pain specialist

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one of the promising areas of research for pain treatment?
What is the role of glial cells in the nervous system, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: They are support structures that have no role in influencing nociception.

options.label: B
options.text: They have a huge role in influencing nociception.

options.label: C
options.text: They are involved in the transmission of pain signals.

options.label: D
options.text: They are responsible for the experience of pain.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for a disorder that prevents people from feeling pain?

options.label: B
options.text: A team of healthcare professionals including pain specialists, physical therapists, clinical psychologists, and nurses

options.label: C
options.text: A combination of medication and physical therapy

options.label: D

options.label: A

title: How this disease changes the shape of your cells - Amber M. Yates

multiple-choice.question: What is the shape of a healthy red blood cell?

options.label: A
options.text: To transport carbon dioxide from tissues to the lungs

options.label: B
options.text: To transport oxygen from the lungs to tissues

options.label: C
options.text: To break down glucose in the bloodstream

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of a single genetic mutation in the structure of hemoglobin?

options.label: A
options.text: The cell becomes more flexible and able to accommodate smaller blood vessels

options.label: B
options.text: The cell becomes harder and stickier, and no longer flows smoothly through blood vessels

options.label: C
options.text: The cell produces more oxygen, allowing tissues to function more efficiently

options.label: D
options.text: The cell is eliminated from the bloodstream

options.label: A
options.text: Repeated episodes of stabbing pain in oxygen-starved tissues

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary benefit of inheriting a single copy of the sickle cell mutation?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the risk of developing sickle-cell anemia

options.label: B
options.text: It makes the individual more susceptible to malaria

options.label: C
options.text: It provides a serious evolutionary advantage in regions rife with malaria

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on the individual's health

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary challenge faced by patients with sickle-cell disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Repeated episodes of stabbing pain in oxygen-starved tissues

options.label: D
options.text: A constantly depleted supply of red blood cells

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary treatment for sickle-cell disease?

options.label: B
options.text: By keeping oxygen bonded to hemoglobin to prevent sickling

options.label: C
options.text: By reducing the stickiness of sickled cells

multiple-choice.question: What is the possibility raised by the ability to edit DNA in the treatment of sickle-cell disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Enabling stem cells to produce normal hemoglobin

options.label: C
options.text: Increasing the lifespan of red blood cells

options.label: D
options.text: Improving the quality of life for patients

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: In regions where malaria is not prevalent

options.label: C
options.text: In regions with a high incidence of sickle-cell anemia

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It is a celebration of the Spanish people's bravery and resilience

options.label: B

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What did the image of a knight fighting a giant snail represent in medieval lore?

options.label: A
options.text: The inevitability of death, which defeats even the strongest knights.

options.label: B
options.text: The knight's need to vanquish his own pride.

multiple-choice.question: What was a common theme in illuminated manuscripts?

options.label: A
options.text: The depiction of everyday life in medieval Europe.

options.label: B
options.text: The representation of mythological creatures and fantastical events.

options.label: C
options.text: The reinforcement of the religious content of the books they decorated.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The common people's resistance to the Church's authority.

options.label: C
options.text: The inevitability of death, which defeats even the strongest rebels.

multiple-choice.question: What did the image of a unicorn in medieval lore represent?

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: To serve as a form of entertainment for the common people.

options.label: C
options.text: To provide a unique window into the minds of medieval artists and to serve various purposes such as private prayer aids, service books in churches, textbooks, and protective talismans.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the image of a clergyman neglecting his duties in the margins of the "Luttrell Psalter"?

options.text: It represented the clergyman's failure to fulfill his spiritual obligations.

options.label: B
options.text: It was a symbol of the clergyman's humility.

options.label: C
options.text: It was a reminder of the family scandal involving Sir Geoffrey's daughter Elizabeth.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the image of an artist painting himself into the manuscript?

options.label: A
options.text: It represented the artist's pride and self-importance.

options.label: B
options.text: It was a symbol of the artist's humility.

options.label: C
options.text: It provided a unique insight into the artist's personality and perspective.

multiple-choice.question: What was the duration of the tradition of illuminated manuscripts in medieval Europe?

title: How to spot a pyramid scheme - Stacie Bosley

multiple-choice.question: What was the initial investment required to start earning money with Vemma Nutrition?
What type of scheme was Vemma Nutrition Company eventually charged with operating?
What is a key characteristic of a pyramid scheme?

options.label: A
options.text: Members primarily earn compensation from selling a product or service

options.label: B
options.text: Members primarily earn compensation from recruiting new sellers

options.label: C
options.text: The founder uses fees from new members to pay existing members

options.label: D
options.text: The scheme is presented as a legitimate multi-level marketing business

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary difference between a pyramid scheme and a legitimate multi-level marketing business?

options.label: A
options.text: The type of product or service being sold

multiple-choice.question: Why can pyramid schemes be difficult to detect?

options.label: A
options.text: They are presented as legitimate multi-level marketing businesses

options.label: B
options.text: They are presented as investment clubs

options.label: C
options.text: They are presented as gifting groups

multiple-choice.question: What is a common tactic used by pyramid schemes to recruit new members?

options.label: A
options.text: Offering a free trial of the product or service

options.label: B
options.text: Promising a high return on investment

options.label: C
options.text: Encouraging existing members to report a good experience

multiple-choice.question: What is a red flag that a scheme may be a pyramid scheme?

options.label: B
options.text: Promises of large, life-altering amounts of income

options.label: C
options.text: A legitimate multi-level marketing business requires members to pay for the opportunity to sell a product or service

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the exponential growth of a pyramid scheme?

options.label: B
options.text: The number of participants expands rapidly

options.label: C
options.text: The most recent recruits lose all the money they paid in

multiple-choice.question: Why can victims of pyramid schemes be embarrassed into silence?

options.label: A
options.text: They are afraid of losing their investment

options.label: B
options.text: They are ashamed of being taken advantage of

options.label: C
options.text: They are worried about damaging their reputation

multiple-choice.question: What is a way to fight against pyramid schemes?

options.label: B
options.text: Sending a video to three people you know

options.label: C
options.text: Encouraging others to invest in a scheme

options.label: D
options.text: Reporting the scheme to the authorities

title: What “Machiavellian” really means - Pazit Cahlon and Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is the main subject of Niccoló Machiavelli's work "The Prince"?

options.label: B
options.text: A guide for monarchs to rule justly and virtuously

options.label: C
options.text: A brief political essay on how to acquire and maintain power

options.label: D
options.text: A critique of the Medici family's rule in Florence

multiple-choice.question: What tradition of works did Machiavelli's "The Prince" draw from?

options.label: B
options.text: "Mirrors for princes" going back to antiquity

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason for Machiavelli's notoriety in the centuries following the publication of "The Prince"?

options.label: A
options.text: His defense of the elected republican government in Florence

options.label: B
options.text: His scathing description of how princely rule operates

options.label: C
options.text: His reputation as a manual for tyranny

options.label: D
options.text: His writings on ideal government and virtuous rule

multiple-choice.question: According to Machiavelli, what is more important for a ruler: to be feared or to be loved?

options.label: A
options.text: To be loved, as it leads to loyalty and devotion

options.label: B
options.text: To be feared, as it leads to respect and obedience

options.label: C
options.text: To be neither feared nor loved, as it leads to a neutral attitude

options.label: D
options.text: To be both feared and loved, as it leads to a balance of power

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Machiavelli's service as a diplomat in Florence?

options.label: A
options.text: He was rewarded with a high-ranking position in the government

options.label: B
options.text: He was tortured and banished by the Medici family

options.label: C
options.text: He wrote "The Prince" as a defense of princely rule

options.label: D
options.text: He became a member of the Medici family

multiple-choice.question: What did Enlightenment figures like Spinoza see in Machiavelli's "The Prince"?

options.label: A
options.text: A defense of princely rule and tyranny

options.label: B
options.text: A warning to free citizens of the ways in which they can be subjugated by aspiring rulers

options.label: C
options.text: A critique of the Medici family's rule in Florence

options.label: D
options.text: A guide for monarchs to rule justly and virtuously

multiple-choice.question: What was Machiavelli's goal in writing "The Prince"?

options.label: A
options.text: To shatter popular delusions about what power really entails

options.label: B
options.text: To defend the elected republican government in Florence

options.label: C
options.text: To reveal the cards to those who would be ruled

options.label: D
options.text: To promote the rule of the Medici family

multiple-choice.question: What did Machiavelli hope people would learn from his work?

options.label: A
options.text: The way to Hell in order to escape it

options.label: B
options.text: The way to achieve power and maintain it

options.label: C
options.text: The importance of being loved by one's subjects

options.label: D
options.text: The importance of being feared by one's subjects

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Machiavelli's work in laying the foundations for future thinkers?

options.label: A
options.text: He revolutionized political philosophy by studying human affairs based on their concrete realities

options.label: B
options.text: He promoted the rule of the Medici family

options.label: C
options.text: He defended the elected republican government in Florence

options.label: D
options.text: He wrote a guide for monarchs to rule justly and virtuously

multiple-choice.question: What did Isaiah Berlin suggest about Machiavelli's work?

options.label: A
options.text: That it was amoral and promoted the rule of the Medici family

options.label: B
options.text: That it hearkened back to ancient Greek morality, placing the glory of the state above individual salvation

options.label: C
options.text: That it was a critique of the Medici family's rule in Florence

options.label: D
options.text: That it was a guide for monarchs to rule justly and virtuously
